name: component-forked-daapd-basicinfo
description:
Analysis of the usr/bin/forked-daapd file reveals:
1. The file is a 32-bit ARM architecture ELF executable, compiled with GCC 4.5.3
2. Due to tool limitations, version strings cannot be directly extracted
3. Based on compilation information, it is likely an older version

Recommended next steps:
1. Check system documentation or configuration files for version information
2. Investigate historical versions and known vulnerabilities of forked-daapd
notes: Unable to retrieve version information due to tool limitations. It is recommended to use a more comprehensive analysis environment or check relevant configuration files. The compilation time (2012) suggests this may be an older version that could contain known vulnerabilities. Incomplete version information requires further verification.

name: component-forked-daapd-version
description: Version information 'forked-daapd/0.19' was found in the usr/bin/forked-daapd binary file, located at address 0x00051d46 in the .rodata section. This version information can be used to query known vulnerabilities in the NVD database.
notes: The version string is hardcoded in the read-only data segment of the binary file and can serve as a reliable basis for querying CVEs.

name: component-xagent-3.2.6
description: xagent component version 3.2.6, confirmed through string analysis. The uClibc library on which this component depends contains multiple critical vulnerabilities (CVE-2017-9728, CVE-2022-29503, CVE-2021-43523).
notes: The binary file has been stripped, increasing the analysis difficulty. It is recommended to update the uClibc dependency and recompile.

name: component-leafp2p-2.1.7

notes: Further verification is required for the exact versions of OpenSSL and zlib. It is recommended to check the relevant CVEs for leafp2p 2.1.7.

name: dependency-openssl-1.0.0
description: OpenSSL 1.0.0 series (end-of-life), identified by library files libssl.so.1.0.0 and libcrypto.so.1.0.0. This version contains multiple known vulnerabilities.
notes: It is recommended to upgrade to OpenSSL 1.0.2u or a later version. The exact version number needs to be verified.

name: component-openssl-1.0.0g
description: OpenSSL version 1.0.0g (released on January 18, 2012) contains multiple version strings in the .rodata section of the lib/libssl.so file. This version has several critical vulnerabilities.
notes: Version 1.0.0g contains multiple high-risk vulnerabilities, particularly CVE-2014-0224 (CCS Injection) with a CVSS score of 7.4. It is recommended to upgrade to the latest stable version of OpenSSL.
